extendedInfo.description: Take back your home world from alien invaders! Forge an Intergalactic Alliance (with untrustworthy allies) to reclaim your planet; blast your way to victory with an ever-expanding arsenal. Will you sacrifice civilian lives to exact vengeance on your enemies? "The Fleet" is an interactive novel where you control the main character. In each chapter, your choices determine how the story proceeds. Will you return home as a military dictator, a prisoner of war, or the president of a puppet state? Will you even recognize home when you get there?

reviews.title: Another interesting story
reviews.comment: Nice game but a little bit more freedom to choose the way you end up would be welcome. Still I enjoyed this game very much.
reviews.author: Alexander Biryukov

reviews.title: I like how theres more
reviews.comment: Stratagy to this one but it is really short and therea no save system so if u fail u have to start from the start. Good game overall.
reviews.author: Michael Gilmore

reviews.comment: Although the idea was good, it was very linear. Plus, the diction wasn\'t very high level and the stats don\'t pertain well enough.
reviews.author: Sam Young

reviews.title: Short and Linear
reviews.comment: I love most of the other CoG games but this one is definitely a step down. It\'s rather short and very linear. IMO, not really worth the $2.99.  Maybe .99 at most.    It\'s not bad, but it definitely could be fleshed out a bit more, especially the relationships with your crew and the ambassadors, as well as the battles. If this was done, then the price would be justified I think.
reviews.author: Matt Noggle

reviews.title: So so
reviews.comment: Story was short, ok but not as good as some of the others I\'ve played.
reviews.author: Wesley de Matos Reis

reviews.title: good
reviews.comment: its quite cleverly done. and remniscent of battlestar galactica :)
reviews.author: Victor Reijkersz

reviews.title: Much Better
reviews.comment: After the last release, City of the Clouds, I thought COG was gonna take a nose dive and never recover again, but the fleet seems quite good, actually.  Just a bug to report, after I spoke to the empress of the Alliance, I found that my force had turned to elegance.  A major problem as I next had to make that speech about force over elegance.  P.S.  Us it possible to be a military dictator?  Overthrow the alliance, take over with the lieutenant?
reviews.author: David Woo

reviews.comment: Fun, but felt a bit short
reviews.author: A Google User
